00006 namespace eval menus {
00007 
00008   variable profile_report  [file join $::tke_home profiling_report.log]
00009   variable show_split_pane 0
00010 
00011   array set profiling_info {}

00013   #######################
00014   #  PUBLIC PROCEDURES  #
00015   #######################
00016 
00017   ######################################################################
00018   # Returns the menu associated with the given menu path.  The menu path
00019   # should be a list where each menu item is the name of the menu within
00020   # the path.  The final menu in the path should not be included in the
00021   # path.
00022   proc get_menu {menu_path} {
00023 
00024     set parent .menubar
00025 
00026     foreach mnu $menu_path {
00027       if {([set mnu_index [$parent index [msgcat::mc $mnu]]] eq "none") || ([$parent type $mnu_index] ne "cascade")} {
00028         return -code error "Invalid menu path specified"
00029       }
00030       set parent [$parent entrycget $mnu_index -menu]
00031     }
00032 
00033     return $parent
00034 
00035   }
00036 
00037   ######################################################################
00038   # Invokes the given index in the given menu, executing the menu's postcommand
00039   # if one exists.
00040   proc invoke {mnu index} {
00041 
00042     # If the menu contains a postcommand, execute it first
00043     if {[$mnu cget -postcommand] ne ""} {
00044       eval [$mnu cget -postcommand]
00045     }
00046 
00047     # Next, invoke the menu
00048     $mnu invoke $index
00049 
00050   }
00051 
00052   ######################################################################
00053   # Creates the main menu.
00054   proc create {} {
00055 
00056     set foreground [utils::get_default_foreground]
00057     set background [utils::get_default_background]
00058 
00059     set mb [menu .menubar -foreground $foreground -background $background -relief flat -tearoff false]
00060 
00061     # Add the file menu
00062     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "File"] -menu [menu $mb.file -relief flat -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::file_posting $mb.file"]
00063     add_file $mb.file
00064 
00065     # Add the edit menu
00066     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Edit"] -menu [menu $mb.edit -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::edit_posting $mb.edit"]
00067     add_edit $mb.edit
00068 
00069     # Add the find menu
00070     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Find"] -menu [menu $mb.find -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::find_posting $mb.find"]
00071     add_find $mb.find
00072 
00073     # Add the text menu
00074     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Text"] -menu [menu $mb.text -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::text_posting $mb.text"]
00075     add_text $mb.text
00076 
00077     # Add the view menu
00078     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "View"] -menu [menu $mb.view -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::view_posting $mb.view"]
00079     add_view $mb.view
00080 
00081     # Add the tools menu
00082     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Tools"] -menu [menu $mb.tools -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::tools_posting $mb.tools"]
00083     add_tools $mb.tools
00084 
00085     # Add the plugins menu
00086     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Plugins"] -menu [menu $mb.plugins -tearoff false]
00087     add_plugins $mb.plugins
00088 
00089     # Add the help menu
00090     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Help"] -menu [menu $mb.help -tearoff false]
00091     add_help $mb.help
00092 
00093     # If we are running on Mac OS X, add the window menu with the windowlist package
00094     if {[tk windowingsystem] eq "aqua"} {
00095 
00096       # Add the window menu with the windowlist package
00097       windowlist::windowMenu $mb
00098 
00099       # Add the launcher command to show the about window
00100       launcher::register "Menus: About TKE" gui::show_about
00101 
00102     }
00103 
00104     if {([tk windowingsystem] eq "aqua") || [preferences::get View/ShowMenubar]} {
00105       . configure -menu $mb
00106     }
00107 
00108     # Load and apply the menu bindings
00109     bindings::load
00110 
00111   }
00112 
00113   ######################################################################
00114   # Handles any changes to the General/WindowTheme preference variable.
00115   proc handle_window_theme {theme} {
00116 
00117     set foreground [utils::get_default_foreground]
00118     set background [utils::get_default_background]
00119 
00120     if {[winfo exists .menubar] && ([tk windowingsystem] ne "aqua")} {
00121       .menubar configure -foreground $foreground -background $background
00122     }
00123 
00124   }

00131   # Adds the file menu.
00132   proc add_file {mb} {
00133 
00134     $mb delete 0 end
00135 
00136     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "New"] -underline 0 -command "menus::new_command"
00137     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: New file"] menus::new_command
00138 
00139     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Open File..."] -underline 0 -command "menus::open_command"
00140     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Open file"] menus::open_command
00141 
00142     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Open Directory..."] -underline 5 -command "menus::open_dir_command"
00143     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Open directory"] menus::open_dir_command
00144 
00145     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Open Recent"] -menu [menu $mb.recent -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::file_recent_posting $mb.recent"]
00146     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Open Recent"] menus::launcher
00147 
00148     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Open Favorite"] -menu [menu $mb.favorites -tearoff false -postcommand "menus::file_favorites_posting $mb.favorites"]
00149     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Open Favorite"] favorites::launcher
00150     
00151     $mb add separator
00152     
00153     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Show File Difference"] -underline 3 -command "menus::show_file_diff"
00154     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Show file difference"] menus::show_file_diff
00155 
00156     $mb add separator
00157 
00158     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Save"] -underline 0 -command "menus::save_command"
00159     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Save file"] menus::save_command
00160 
00161     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Save As..."] -underline 5 -command "menus::save_as_command"
00162     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Save file as"] menus::save_as_command
00163 
00164     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Save All"] -underline 6 -command "gui::save_all"
00165     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Save all files"] gui::save_all
00166 
00167     $mb add separator
00168 
00169     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Lock"] -underline 0 -command "menus::lock_command $mb"
00170     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Lock file"] "menus::lock_command $mb"
00171     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Unlock file"] "menus::unlock_command $mb"
00172 
00173     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Favorite"] -underline 0 -command "menus::favorite_command $mb"
00174     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Favorite file"] "menus::favorite_command $mb"
00175     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Unfavorite file"] "menus::unfavorite_command $mb"
00176 
00177     $mb add separator
00178 
00179     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Close"] -underline 0 -command "menus::close_command"
00180     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Close current tab"] menus::close_command
00181 
00182     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Close All"] -underline 6 -command "menus::close_all_command"
00183     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Close all tabs"] menus::close_all_command
00184 
00185     # Only add the quit menu to File if we are not running in aqua
00186     if {[tk windowingsystem] ne "aqua"} {
00187       $mb add separator
00188       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Quit"] -underline 0 -command "menus::exit_command"
00189     }
00190     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Quit application"] menus::exit_command
00191 
00192   }

00194   ######################################################################
00195   # Called prior to the file menu posting.
00196   proc file_posting {mb} {
00197 
00198     # Get the current file index (if one exists)
00199     if {[set file_index [gui::current_file]] != -1} {
00200 
00201       # Get the current readonly status
00202       set readonly [gui::get_file_info $file_index readonly]
00203 
00204       # Get the current file lock status
00205       set file_lock [expr $readonly || [gui::get_file_info [gui::current_file] lock]]
00206 
00207       # Get the current favorite status
00208       set favorite [favorites::is_favorite [gui::get_file_info $file_index fname]]
00209 
00210       # Configure the Lock/Unlock menu item
00211       if {$file_lock && ![catch "$mb index Lock" index]} {
00212         $mb entryconfigure $index -label [msgcat::mc "Unlock"] -state normal -command "menus::unlock_command $mb"
00213         if {$readonly} {
00214           $mb entryconfigure $index -state disabled
00215         }
00216       } elseif {!$file_lock && ![catch "$mb index Unlock" index]} {
00217         $mb entryconfigure $index -label [msgcat::mc "Lock"] -state normal -command "menus::lock_command $mb"
00218       }
00219 
00220       # Configure the Favorite/Unfavorite menu item
00221       if {$favorite && ![catch "$mb index Favorite" index]} {
00222         $mb entryconfigure $index -label [msgcat::mc "Unfavorite"] -state normal -command "menus::unfavorite_command $mb"
00223       } elseif {!$favorite && ![catch "$mb index Unfavorite" index]} {
00224         $mb entryconfigure $index -label [msgcat::mc "Favorite"] -state normal -command "menus::favorite_command $mb"
00225       }
00226 
00227       # Make sure that the file-specific items are enabled
00228       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Show File Difference"] -state normal
00229       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Save"]                 -state normal
00230       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Save As..."]           -state normal
00231       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Save All"]             -state normal
00232       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close"]                -state normal
00233       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close All"]            -state normal
00234 
00235     } else {
00236 
00237       # Disable file menu items associated with current tab (since one doesn't currently exist)
00238       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Show File Difference"] -state disabled
00239       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Save"]                 -state disabled
00240       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Save As..."]           -state disabled
00241       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Save All"]             -state disabled
00242       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Lock"]                 -state disabled
00243       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Favorite"]             -state disabled
00244       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close"]                -state disabled
00245       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close All"]            -state disabled
00246 
00247     }
00248 
00249     # Configure the Open Recent menu
00250     if {([preferences::get View/ShowRecentlyOpened] == 0) || ([llength [gui::get_last_opened]] == 0)} {
00251       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Open Recent"] -state disabled
00252     } else {
00253       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Open Recent"] -state normal
00254     }
00255 
00256     # Configure the Open Favorite menu
00257     if {[llength [favorites::get_list]] == 0} {
00258       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Open Favorite"] -state disabled
00259     } else {
00260       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Open Favorite"] -state normal
00261     }
00262 
00263   }
00264 
00265   ######################################################################
00266   # Sets up the "Open Recent" menu prior to it being posted.
00267   proc file_recent_posting {mb} {
00268 
00269     # Clear the menu
00270     $mb delete 0 end
00271 
00272     # Populate the menu with the filenames and a "Clear All" menu option
00273     foreach fname [lrange [gui::get_last_opened] 0 [expr [preferences::get View/ShowRecentlyOpened] - 1]] {
00274       $mb add command -label [file tail $fname] -command "puts \"Adding $fname\"; gui::add_file end $fname"
00275     }
00276     $mb add separator
00277     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Clear All"] -command "gui::clear_last_opened"
00278 
00279   }
00280 
00281   ######################################################################
00282   # Updates the "Open Favorite" menu prior to it being posted.
00283   proc file_favorites_posting {mb} {
00284 
00285     # Clear the menu
00286     $mb delete 0 end
00287 
00288     # Populate the menu with the filenames from the favorite list
00289     foreach path [favorites::get_list] {
00290       if {[file isdirectory $path]} {
00291         $mb add command -label $path -command "sidebar::add_directory $path"
00292       } else {
00293         $mb add command -label $path -command "gui::add_file end $path"
00294       }
00295     }
00296 
00297   }

00303     gui::add_new_file end
00304 
00305   }

00307   ######################################################################
00308   # Opens a new file and adds a new tab for the file.
00309   proc open_command {} {
00310 
00311     # Get the directory of the current file
00312     set dirname [file dirname [gui::current_filename]]
00313 
00314     if {[set ofiles [tk_getOpenFile -parent . -initialdir $dirname -filetypes [syntax::get_filetypes] -defaultextension .tcl -multiple 1]] ne ""} {
00315       foreach ofile $ofiles {
00316         gui::add_file end $ofile
00317       }
00318     }
00319 
00320   }
00321 
00322   ######################################################################
00323   # Opens a directory in the sidebar.
00324   proc open_dir_command {} {
00325 
00326     # Get the directory of the current file
00327     set dirname [file dirname [gui::current_filename]]
00328 
00329     if {[set odir [tk_chooseDirectory -parent . -initialdir $dirname -mustexist 1]] ne ""} {
00330       sidebar::add_directory $odir
00331     }
00332 
00333   }

00335   ######################################################################
00336   # Displays the difference of the current file.
00337   proc show_file_diff {} {
00338     
00339     # Get the current filename
00340     set fname [gui::current_filename]
00341     
00342     # Display the current file as a difference
00343     gui::add_file end $fname -diff 1
00344     
00345   }
00346   
00347   ######################################################################
00348   # Saves the current tab file.
00349   proc save_command {} {
00350 
00351     if {[set sfile [gui::current_filename]] eq ""} {
00352       save_as_command
00353     } else {
00354       gui::save_current {} $sfile
00355     }
00356 
00357   }
00358 
00359   ######################################################################
00360   # Saves the current tab file as a new filename.
00361   proc save_as_command {} {
00362 
00363     # Get the directory of the current file
00364     set dirname [file dirname [gui::current_filename]]
00365 
00366     # Get some of the save options
00367     set save_opts [list]
00368     if {[llength [set extensions [syntax::get_extensions {}]]] > 0} {
00369       lappend save_opts -defaultextension [lindex $extensions 0]
00370     }
00371 
00372     if {[set sfile [tk_getSaveFile {*}$save_opts -title [msgcat::mc "Save As"] -parent . -initialdir $dirname]] ne ""} {
00373       gui::save_current {} $sfile
00374     }
00375 
00376   }
00377 
00378   ######################################################################
00379   # Locks the current file.
00380   proc lock_command {mb} {
00381 
00382     # Lock the current file
00383     if {[gui::set_current_file_lock {} 1]} {
00384 
00385       # Set the menu up to display the unlock file menu option
00386       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Lock"] -label [msgcat::mc "Unlock"] -command "menus::unlock_command $mb"
00387 
00388     }
00389 
00390   }
00391 
00392   ######################################################################
00393   # Unlocks the current file.
00394   proc unlock_command {mb} {
00395 
00396     # Unlock the current file
00397     if {[gui::set_current_file_lock {} 0]} {
00398 
00399       # Set the menu up to display the lock file menu option
00400       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Unlock"] -label [msgcat::mc "Lock"] -command "menus::lock_command $mb"
00401 
00402     }
00403 
00404   }

00406   ######################################################################
00407   # Marks the current file as a favorite.
00408   proc favorite_command {mb} {
00409 
00410     # Get the current file index (if one exists)
00411     if {[set file_index [gui::current_file]] != -1} {
00412 
00413       # Add the file as a favorite
00414       if {[favorites::add [gui::get_file_info $file_index fname]]} {
00415 
00416         # Set the menu up to display the unfavorite file menu option
00417         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Favorite"] -label [msgcat::mc "Unfavorite"] -command "menus::unfavorite_command $mb"
00418 
00419       }
00420 
00421     }
00422 
00423   }
00424 
00425   ######################################################################
00426   # Marks the current file as not favorited.
00427   proc unfavorite_command {mb} {
00428 
00429     # Get the current file index (if one exists)
00430     if {[set file_index [gui::current_file]] != -1} {
00431 
00432       # Remove the file as a favorite
00433       if {[favorites::remove [gui::get_file_info $file_index fname]]} {
00434 
00435         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Unfavorite"] -label [msgcat::mc "Favorite"] -command "menus::favorite_command $mb"
00436 
00437       }
00438 
00439     }
00440 
00441   }

00459   ######################################################################
00460   # Cleans up the application to prepare it for being exited.
00461   proc exit_cleanup {} {
00462 
00463     # Save the session information if we are not told to exit on close
00464     gui::save_session
00465 
00466     # Close all of the tabs
00467     gui::close_all 1
00468 
00469     # Save the clipboard history
00470     cliphist::save
00471 
00472     # Handle on_quit plugins
00473     plugins::handle_on_quit
00474 
00475     # Turn off profiling (if it was turned on)
00476     if {[::tke_development]} {
00477       stop_profiling_command .menubar.tools 0
00478     }
00479     
00480     # Stop the logger
00481     logger::on_exit
00482 
00483   }
00484 
00485   ######################################################################
00486   # Exits the application.
00487   proc exit_command {} {
00488 
00489     # Clean up the application
00490     exit_cleanup
00491 
00492     # Destroy the interface
00493     destroy .
00494 
00495   }

00579

00581     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Set user bindings to global bindings"] "bindings::copy_default"

00584     $mb.snipPopup add command -label [msgcat::mc "Edit User"] -command "snippets::add_new_snippet {} user"
00585     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu Edit user snippets"] "snippets::add_new_snippet {} user"
00586     
00587     $mb.snipPopup add command -label [msgcat::mc "Edit Language"] -command "snippets::add_new_snippet {} lang"
00588     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Edit language snippets"] "snippets::add_new_snippet {} lang"
00589

00591 
00592     $mb.snipPopup add command -label [msgcat::mc "Reload"] -command "snippets::reload_snippets"
00593     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Reload snippets"] "snippets::reload_snippets"

00597   ######################################################################
00598   # Called just prior to posting the edit menu.  Sets the state of all
00599   # menu items to match the proper state of the UI.
00600   proc edit_posting {mb} {
00601 
00602     if {[gui::current_txt {}] eq ""} {
00603       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Undo"]             -state disabled
00604       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Redo"]             -state disabled
00605       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Cut"]              -state disabled
00606       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Copy"]             -state disabled
00607       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Paste"]            -state disabled
00608       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Paste and Format"] -state disabled
00609       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select All"]       -state disabled
00610       catch { $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Enable Auto-Indent"]  -state disabled }
00611       catch { $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Disable Auto-Indent"] -state disabled }
00612       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Insert Text"]      -state disabled
00613       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Format Text"]      -state disabled
00614     } else {
00615       if {[gui::undoable {}]} {
00616         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Undo"] -state normal
00617       } else {
00618         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Undo"] -state disabled
00619       }
00620       if {[gui::redoable {}]} {
00621         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Redo"] -state normal
00622       } else {
00623         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Redo"] -state disabled
00624       }
00625       if {[gui::selected {}]} {
00626         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Cut"]  -state normal
00627         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Copy"] -state normal
00628       } else {
00629         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Cut"]  -state disabled
00630         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Copy"] -state disabled
00631       }
00632       if {[gui::pastable {}]} {
00633         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Paste"]            -state normal
00634         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Paste and Format"] -state normal
00635       } else {
00636         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Paste"]            -state disabled
00637         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Paste and Format"] -state disabled
00638       }
00639       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select All"]  -state normal
00640       set auto_indent_state [expr {[indent::is_auto_indent_available [gui::current_txt {}]] ? "normal" : "disabled"}]
00641       if {[indent::get_auto_indent [gui::current_txt {}]] && ![catch "$mb index {Enable Auto-Indent}" index]} {
00642         $mb entryconfigure $index -label [msgcat::mc "Disable Auto-Indent"] -underline 13 -state $auto_indent_state -command "gui::set_current_auto_indent {} 0"
00643       } elseif {![indent::get_auto_indent [gui::current_txt {}]] && ![catch "$mb index {Disable Auto-Indent}" index]} {
00644         $mb entryconfigure $index -label [msgcat::mc "Enable Auto-Indent"] -underline 12 -state $auto_indent_state -command "gui::set_current_auto_indent {} 1"
00645       }
00646       if {[gui::editable {}]} {
00647         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Insert Text"] -state normal
00648       } else {
00649         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Insert Text"] -state disabled
00650       }
00651       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Format Text"] -state normal
00652     }
00653 
00654   }

00778   ######################################################################
00779   # Called just prior to posting the find menu.  Sets the state of the menu
00780   # items to match the current UI state.
00781   proc find_posting {mb} {
00782 
00783     if {[set txt [gui::current_txt {}]] eq ""} {
00784       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find"]                       -state disabled
00785       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find and Replace"]           -state disabled
00786       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select next occurrence"]     -state disabled
00787       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select previous occurrence"] -state disabled
00788       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Append next occurrence"]     -state disabled
00789       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select all occurrences"]     -state disabled
00790       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Jump backward"]              -state disabled
00791       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Jump forward"]               -state disabled
00792       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Next difference"]            -state disabled
00793       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Previous difference"]        -state disabled
00794       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Markers"]                    -state disabled
00795       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find matching pair"]         -state disabled
00796     } else {
00797       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find"]                       -state normal
00798       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find and Replace"]           -state normal
00799       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select next occurrence"]     -state normal
00800       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select previous occurrence"] -state normal
00801       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Append next occurrence"]     -state normal
00802       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Select all occurrences"]     -state normal
00803       if {[gui::jump_to_cursor {} -1 0]} {
00804         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Jump backward"] -state normal
00805       } else {
00806         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Jump backward"] -state disabled
00807       }
00808       if {[gui::jump_to_cursor {} 1 0]} {
00809         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Jump forward"] -state normal
00810       } else {
00811         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Jump forward"] -state disabled
00812       }
00813       if {[gui::jump_to_difference {} 1 0]} {
00814         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Next difference"]     -state normal
00815         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Previous difference"] -state normal
00816       } else {
00817         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Next difference"]     -state disabled
00818         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Previous difference"] -state disabled
00819       }
00820       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Find matching pair"] -state normal
00821       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Markers"] -state normal
00822     }
00823 
00824   }

00826   ######################################################################
00827   # Called when the marker menu is opened.
00828   proc find_marker_posting {mb} {
00829 
00830     # Clear the menu
00831     $mb delete 0 end
00832 
00833     # Populate the markerPopup menu
00834     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Create at current line"] -underline 0 -command "gui::create_current_marker {}" 
00835     $mb add separator
00836     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Remove from current line"] -underline 0 -command "gui::remove_current_marker {}" 
00837     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Remove all markers"] -underline 7 -command "gui::remove_all_markers {}"
00838     
00839     if {[llength [set markers [gui::get_marker_list {}]]] > 0} {
00840       $mb add separator
00841     }
00842 
00843     foreach {marker pos} $markers {
00844       $mb add command -label $marker -command "gui::jump_to {} $pos"
00845     }
00846 
00847   }

00849   ######################################################################
00850   # Performs an egrep-like search in a user-specified list of files/directories.
00851   proc find_in_files {} {
00852 
00853     set rsp_list [list]
00854 
00855     # Display the find UI to the user and get input
00856     if {[gui::fif_get_input rsp_list]} {
00857 
00858       array set rsp $rsp_list
00859 
00860       # Convert directories into files
00861       array set files {}
00862       foreach file $rsp(in) {
00863         if {[file isdirectory $file]} {
00864           foreach sfile [glob -nocomplain -directory $file -types {f r} *] {
00865             if {![sidebar::ignore_file $sfile]} {
00866               set files($sfile) 1
00867             }
00868           }
00869         } elseif {![sidebar::ignore_file $file]} {
00870           set files($file) 1
00871         }
00872       }
00873 
00874       # Perform egrep operation (test)
00875       if {[array size files] > 0} {
00876         bgproc::system find_in_files "egrep -a -H -C[preferences::get Find/ContextNum] -n $rsp(egrep_opts) -s {$rsp(find)} [lsort [array names files]]" -killable 1 \
00877           -callback "menus::find_in_files_callback [list $rsp(find)] [array size files]"
00878       } else {
00879         gui::set_info_message "No files found in specified directories"
00880       }
00881 
00882     }
00883 
00884   }
00885 
00886   ######################################################################
00887   # Called when the egrep operation has completed.
00888   proc find_in_files_callback {find_expr num_files err data} {
00889 
00890     variable txt_cursor
00891 
00892     # Add the file to the viewer
00893     gui::add_file end Results -sidebar 0 -buffer 1
00894 
00895     # Add bindings to allow one-click file opening
00896     set txt [gui::current_txt {}]
00897 
00898     # Get the last index of the text widget
00899     set last_line [$txt index end]
00900 
00901     # Insert a starting mark
00902     $txt insert end "----\n"
00903 
00904     if {!$err || ($num_files == 0)} {
00905 
00906       # Save the text cursor
00907       set txt_cursor [$txt cget -cursor]
00908 
00909       # Append the results to the text widget
00910       $txt insert end [find_in_files_format $data]
00911 
00912       # Highlight and bind the matches
00913       $txt tag configure fif -underline 1 -borderwidth 1 -relief raised -foreground black -background yellow
00914       set i 0
00915       foreach index [$txt search -regexp -all -count find_counts -- $find_expr $last_line] {
00916         $txt tag add fif $index "$index + [lindex $find_counts $i]c"
00917         $txt tag bind fif <Enter>           { %W configure -cursor hand2 }
00918         $txt tag bind fif <Leave>           { %W configure -cursor $menus::txt_cursor }
00919         $txt tag bind fif <ButtonRelease-1> { menus::find_in_files_handle_click %W %x %y }
00920         incr i
00921       }
00922 
00923       bind $txt <Key-space> { if {[menus::find_in_files_handle_space %W]} break }
00924 
00925     } else {
00926 
00927       $txt insert end "ERROR: $data\n\n\n"
00928 
00929     }
00930 
00931     # Adjust the Vim insert cursor
00932     vim::adjust_insert $txt.t
00933 
00934     # Make sure that the beginning of the inserted text is in view
00935     $txt see end
00936     $txt mark set insert $last_line
00937     $txt see $last_line
00938 
00939   }
00940 
00941   ######################################################################
00942   # Formats the raw egrep data to make it more readable.
00943   proc find_in_files_format {data} {
00944 
00945     set results         ""
00946     set file_results    [list]
00947     set last_linenum    ""
00948     set first_separator 1
00949     array set indices   {}
00950     array set fnames    {}
00951     set index           0
00952     set matches         0
00953 
00954     foreach line [split $data \n] {
00955       if {[regexp {^(.*?)([:-])(\d+)[:-](.*)$} $line -> fname type linenum content]} {
00956         set first_separator 1
00957         if {![info exists fnames($fname)]} {
00958           set fnames($fname) 1
00959           if {[llength $file_results] > 0} {
00960             if {[string trim [lindex $file_results end]] eq "..."} {
00961               set file_results [lrange $file_results 0 end-1]
00962             }
00963             append results "[join $file_results \n]\n\n"
00964             set file_results [list]
00965           }
00966           lappend file_results "  [file normalize $fname]:\n"
00967           set last_linenum ""
00968           array unset indices
00969         }
00970         if {$type eq ":"} {
00971           if {($last_linenum eq "") || ($linenum > $last_linenum)} {
00972             lappend file_results [format "    %6d: %s" $linenum $content]
00973             set indices($linenum) $index
00974             set last_linenum $linenum
00975             incr index
00976           } else {
00977             lset file_results $indices($linenum) [string replace [lindex $file_results $indices($linenum)] 11 11 ":"]
00978           }
00979           incr matches
00980         } else {
00981           if {($last_linenum eq "") || ($linenum > $last_linenum)} {
00982             lappend file_results [format "    %6d  %s" $linenum $content]
00983             set indices($linenum) $index
00984             set last_linenum $linenum
00985             incr index
00986           }
00987         }
00988       } elseif {[string trim $line] eq "--"} {
00989         if {$first_separator} {
00990           set first_separator 0
00991         } else {
00992           lappend file_results "    ..."
00993         }
00994       }
00995     }
00996 
00997     # Append the last files information to the results string
00998     append results "[join $file_results \n]\n\n"
00999 
01000     return "Found $matches [expr {($matches != 1) ? {matches} : {match}}] in [array size fnames] [expr {([array size fnames] != 1) ? {files} : {file}}]\n\n$results"
01001 
01002   }
01003 
01004   ######################################################################
01005   # Handles a left-click on a matched pattern in the given text widget.
01006   # Causes the matching file to be opened and we jump to the matching line.
01007   proc find_in_files_handle_selection {W index} {
01008 
01009     # Get the line number from the beginning of the line
01010     regexp {^\s*(\d+)} [$W get "$index linestart" $index] -> linenum
01011 
01012     # Get the filename of the line that is clicked
01013     set findex [$W search -regexp -backwards -count fif_count -- {^\s*/.*:$} $index]
01014     set fname  [$W get $findex "$findex+[expr $fif_count - 1]c"]
01015 
01016     # Add the file to the file viewer (if necessary)
01017     gui::add_file end [string trim $fname]
01018 
01019     # Jump to the line and set the cursor to the beginning of the line
01020     set txt [gui::current_txt {}]
01021     $txt see $linenum.0
01022     $txt mark set insert $linenum.0
01023 
01024   }
01025 
01026   ######################################################################
01027   # Handles a left-click on a matched pattern in the given text widget.
01028   proc find_in_files_handle_click {W x y} {
01029 
01030     find_in_files_handle_selection $W [$W index @$x,$y]
01031 
01032   }
01033 
01034   ######################################################################
01035   # Handles a space bar key hit on a matched pattern in the given text
01036   # widget.
01037   proc find_in_files_handle_space {W} {
01038 
01039     # Get the current insertion index
01040     set insert [$W index insert]
01041 
01042     # Check to see if the space bar was hit inside of a tag
01043     foreach {first last} [$W tag ranges fif] {
01044       if {[$W compare $first <= $insert] && [$W compare $insert < $last]} {
01045         find_in_files_handle_selection $W [$W index insert]
01046         return 1
01047       }
01048     }
01049 
01050     return 0
01051 
01052   }
01053

01065     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Indent selected text"] "texttools::indent {}"

01068     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Unindent selected text"] "texttools::unindent {}"

01073     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Replace line with script"] "texttools::replace_line_with_script {}"

01078     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Align cursors"] "texttools::align {}"

01085   ######################################################################
01086   # Called prior to the text menu posting.
01087   proc text_posting {mb} {
01088 
01089     if {[set txt [gui::current_txt {}]] eq ""} {
01090       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Comment"]                  -state disabled
01091       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Uncomment"]                -state disabled
01092       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Indent"]                   -state disabled
01093       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Unindent"]                 -state disabled
01094       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Replace line with script"] -state disabled
01095       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Align cursors"]            -state disabled
01096       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Insert enumeration"]       -state disabled
01097     } else {
01098       if {[lindex [syntax::get_comments [gui::current_txt {}]] 0] eq ""} {
01099         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Comment"]   -state disabled
01100         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Uncomment"] -state disabled
01101       } else {
01102         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Comment"]   -state normal
01103         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Uncomment"] -state normal
01104       }
01105       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Indent"]   -state normal
01106       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Unindent"] -state normal
01107       if {[texttools::current_line_empty {}]} {
01108         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Replace line with script"] -state disabled
01109       } else {
01110         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Replace line with script"] -state normal
01111       }
01112       if {[multicursor::enabled $txt]} {
01113         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Align cursors"]      -state normal
01114         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Insert enumeration"] -state normal
01115       } else {
01116         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Align cursors"]      -state disabled
01117         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Insert enumeration"] -state disabled
01118       }
01119     }
01120 
01121   }
01122 
01123   ######################################################################

01133     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Hide sidebar"] "menus::hide_sidebar_view $mb"

01138       } else {

01140       }
01141       launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Show console"] "menus::show_console_view $mb"
01142       launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Hide console"] "menus::hide_console_view $mb"

01145     if {[preferences::get View/ShowTabBar]} {
01146       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Hide Tab Bar"] -underline 5 -command "menus::hide_tab_view $mb"
01147     } else {
01148       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Show Tab Bar"] -underline 5 -command "menus::show_tab_view $mb"
01149     }
01150     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Show Tab Bar"] "menus::show_tab_view $mb"
01151     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Hide Tab Bar"] "menus::hide_tab_view $mb"

01154       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Hide Status Bar"] -underline 12 -command "menus::hide_status_view $mb"
01155     } else {
01156       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Show Status Bar"] -underline 12 -command "menus::show_status_view $mb"
01157     }

01159     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Hide status bar"] "menus::hide_status_view $mb"

01164       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Hide Line Numbers"] -underline 5 -command "menus::hide_line_numbers $mb"
01165     } else {
01166       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Show Line Numbers"] -underline 5 -command "menus::show_line_numbers $mb"
01167     }
01168     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Show Line Numbers"] "menus::show_line_numbers $mb"
01169     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Hide Line Numbers"] "menus::hide_line_numbers $mb"

01174     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Toggle split view mode"] "gui::toggle_split_pane {}"

01177     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Move to other pane"] "gui::move_to_pane"
01178

01182 
01183     $mb add separator
01184

01186     $mb add cascade -label [msgcat::mc "Set Theme"]  -underline 7 -menu [menu $mb.themeMenu  -tearoff 0 -postcommand "syntax::populate_theme_menu $mb.themeMenu"]
01187 
01188     # Setup the tab popup menu
01189     $mb.tabPopup add command -label [msgcat::mc "Goto Next Tab"] -underline 5 -command "gui::next_tab"
01190     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Goto next tab"] "gui::next_tab"
01191 
01192     $mb.tabPopup add command -label [msgcat::mc "Goto Previous Tab"] -underline 5 -command "gui::previous_tab"
01193     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Goto previous tab"] "gui::previous_tab"
01194 
01195     $mb.tabPopup add command -label [msgcat::mc "Goto Last Tab"] -underline 5 -command "gui::last_tab"
01196     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Goto last tab"] "gui::last_tab"
01197 
01198     $mb.tabPopup add command -label [msgcat::mc "Goto Other Pane"] -underline 11 -command "gui::next_pane"
01199     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Goto other pane"] "gui::next_pane"
01200 
01201     $mb.tabPopup add separator
01202 
01203     $mb.tabPopup add command -label [msgcat::mc "Sort Tabs"] -underline 0 -command "gui::sort_tabs"
01204     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Sort tabs"] "gui::sort_tabs"
01205 
01206   }

01208   ######################################################################
01209   # Called just prior to posting the view menu.  Sets the state of the
01210   # menu options to match the current UI state.
01211   proc view_posting {mb} {
01212 
01213     variable show_split_pane
01214     
01215     if {([gui::tabs_in_pane] < 2) && ([gui::panes] < 2)} {
01216       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Tabs"] -state disabled
01217     } else {
01218       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Tabs"] -state normal
01219     }
01220 
01221     if {[gui::current_txt {}] eq ""} {
01222       catch { $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Show Line Numbers"]  -state disabled }
01223       catch { $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Hide Line Numbers"]  -state disabled }
01224       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Split view"]         -state disabled
01225       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Move to other pane"] -state disabled
01226       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Set Syntax"]         -state disabled
01227     } else {
01228       catch { $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Show Line Numbers"]  -state normal }
01229       catch { $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Hide Line Numbers"]  -state normal }
01230       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Split view"]         -state normal
01231       if {[gui::movable_to_other_pane]} {
01232         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Move to other pane"] -state normal
01233       } else {
01234         $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Move to other pane"] -state disabled
01235       }
01236       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Set Syntax"]         -state normal
01237       set show_split_pane [expr {[llength [[gui::current_txt {}] peer names]] > 0}]
01238     }
01239 
01240   }
01241 
01242   ######################################################################
01243   # Called just prior to posting the view/tabs menu.  Sets the state of
01244   # the menu options to match the current UI state.
01245   proc view_tabs_posting {mb} {
01246 
01247     if {[gui::tabs_in_pane] < 2} {
01248       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Next Tab"]     -state disabled
01249       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Previous Tab"] -state disabled
01250       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Last Tab"]     -state disabled
01251       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Sort Tabs"]         -state disabled
01252     } else {
01253       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Next Tab"]     -state normal
01254       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Previous Tab"] -state normal
01255       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Last Tab"]     -state normal
01256       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Sort Tabs"]         -state normal
01257     }
01258 
01259     if {[gui::panes] < 2} {
01260       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Other Pane"] -state disabled
01261     } else {
01262       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Goto Other Pane"] -state normal
01263     }
01264 
01265   }

01455   ######################################################################
01456   # Allows the user to select one of the Tke themes to edit and calls
01457   # up the theme editor.
01458   proc edit_theme_command {} {
01459 
01460     # Attempt to get the name of an available theme
01461     if {[set name [themer::get_theme]] ne ""} {
01462 
01463       # Call the themer importer for the given tke file
01464       themer::import_tke $name syntax::load_themes
01465 
01466     }
01467 
01468   }

01470   ######################################################################
01471   # Allows the user to select an existing TextMate theme to import and
01472   # calls the theme importer.
01473   proc import_tm_command {} {
01474 
01475     # Open a TextMate theme
01476     if {[set name [tk_getOpenFile -filetypes {{TextMate {.tmTheme .tmtheme}}} -initialdir [pwd] -parent . -title "Select TextMate theme"]] ne ""} {
01477 
01478       # Call the themer importer for the given TextMate file
01479       themer::import_tm $name syntax::load_themes
01480 
01481     }
01482 
01483   }

01485   ######################################################################
01486   # Starts the procedure profiling.
01487   proc start_profiling_command {mb} {
01488 
01489     if {[$mb entrycget [msgcat::mc "Start Profiling"] -state] eq "normal"} {
01490 
01491       # Turn on procedure profiling
01492       profile {*}[preferences::get Tools/ProfileReportOptions] on
01493 
01494       # Indicate that profiling mode is on
01495       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Start Profiling"] -state disabled
01496       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Stop Profiling"]  -state normal
01497 
01498       # Indicate that profiling has started in the information bar
01499       gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "Profiling started"]
01500 
01501     }
01502 
01503   }
01504 
01505   ######################################################################
01506   # Stops the profiling process, generates a report and displays the
01507   # report file to a new editor tab.
01508   proc stop_profiling_command {mb show_report} {
01509 
01510     variable profile_report
01511     variable profiling_info
01512 
01513     if {[$mb entrycget [msgcat::mc "Stop Profiling"] -state] eq "normal"} {
01514 
01515       # Turn off procedure profiling
01516       profile off profiling_info
01517 
01518       # Generate a report file
01519       generate_profile_report
01520       # set sortby [preferences::get Tools/ProfileReportSortby]
01521       # profrep profiling_info $sortby $profile_report "Profiling Information Sorted by $sortby"
01522 
01523       # Indicate that profiling has completed
01524       gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "Profiling stopped"]
01525 
01526       # Add the report to the tab list
01527       if {$show_report} {
01528         show_last_profiling_report
01529       }
01530 
01531       # Indicate that profiling mode is off
01532       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Stop Profiling"] -state disabled
01533       $mb entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Start Profiling"] -state normal
01534 
01535     }
01536 
01537   }
01538 
01539   ######################################################################
01540   # Displays the last profiling report.
01541   proc show_last_profiling_report {} {
01542 
01543     variable profile_report
01544 
01545     # If the profiling report exists, display it
01546     if {[file exists $profile_report]} {
01547       gui::add_file end $profile_report -lock 1
01548     }
01549 
01550   }
01551 
01552   ######################################################################
01553   # Generates a profiling report.
01554   proc generate_profile_report {} {
01555 
01556     variable profile_report
01557     variable profiling_info
01558 
01559     # Recollect the data
01560     set info_list [list]
01561     foreach info [array names profiling_info] {
01562 
01563       set name [lindex $info 0]
01564 
01565       # If the name matches anything that we don't want to profile,
01566       # skip to the next iteration now
01567       if {[regexp {^(((::)?(tk::|tcl::|ttk::|tablelist::|mwutil::))|<global>|::\w+$)} $name]} {
01568         continue
01569       }
01570 
01571       set calls [lindex $profiling_info($info) 0]
01572       set real  [lindex $profiling_info($info) 1]
01573       set cpu   [lindex $profiling_info($info) 2]
01574 
01575       if {[set index [lsearch -index 0 $info_list [lindex $info 0]]] == -1} {
01576         lappend info_list [list [lindex $info 0] $calls $real $cpu 0.0 0.0]
01577       } else {
01578         set info_entry [lindex $info_list $index]
01579         lset info_list $index 1 [expr [lindex $info_entry 1] + $calls]
01580         lset info_list $index 2 [expr [lindex $info_entry 2] + $real]
01581         lset info_list $index 3 [expr [lindex $info_entry 3] + $cpu]
01582       }
01583 
01584     }
01585 
01586     # Calculate the real/call and cpu/call values
01587     for {set i 0} {$i < [llength $info_list]} {incr i} {
01588       set info_entry [lindex $info_list $i]
01589       if {[lindex $info_entry 1] > 0} {
01590         lset info_list $i 4 [expr [lindex $info_entry 2].0 / [lindex $info_entry 1]]
01591         lset info_list $i 5 [expr [lindex $info_entry 3].0 / [lindex $info_entry 1]]
01592       }
01593     }
01594 
01595     # Sort the information
01596     switch [preferences::get Tools/ProfileReportSortby] {
01597       "calls"         { set info_list [lsort -decreasing -integer -index 1 $info_list] }
01598       "real"          { set info_list [lsort -decreasing -integer -index 2 $info_list] }
01599       "cpu"           { set info_list [lsort -decreasing -integer -index 3 $info_list] }
01600       "real_per_call" { set info_list [lsort -decreasing -real -index 4 $info_list] }
01601       "cpu_per_call"  { set info_list [lsort -decreasing -real -index 5 $info_list] }
01602       default         { set info_list [lsort -index 0 $info_list] }
01603     }
01604 
01605     # Create the report file
01606     if {![catch "open $profile_report w" rc]} {
01607 
01608       puts $rc "=============================================================================================================="
01609       puts $rc [msgcat::mc "                                  Profiling Report Sorted By (%s)" [preferences::get Tools/ProfileReportSortby]]
01610       puts $rc "=============================================================================================================="
01611       puts $rc [format "%-50s  %10s  %10s  %10s  %10s  %10s" "Procedure" "Calls" "Real" "CPU" "Real/Calls" "CPU/Calls"]
01612       puts $rc "=============================================================================================================="
01613 
01614       foreach info $info_list {
01615         puts $rc [format "%-50s  %10d  %10d  %10d  %10.3f  %10.3f" {*}$info]
01616       }
01617 
01618       close $rc
01619 
01620     }
01621 
01622   }
01623 
01624   ######################################################################
01625   # Restart the GUI.
01626   proc restart_command {} {
01627 
01628     # Get the list of filenames to start
01629     set filenames [gui::get_actual_filenames]
01630 
01631     # Execute the restart command
01632     exec [info nameofexecutable] [file join $::tke_dir restart.tcl] [info nameofexecutable] [file join $::tke_dir tke.tcl] {*}$filenames &
01633 
01634   }
01635 
01636   ######################################################################
01637   # Add the plugins menu commands.
01638   proc add_plugins {mb} {
01639 
01640     # Add plugins menu commands
01641     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Install..."] -underline 0 -command "plugins::install"
01642     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Install plugin"] "plugins::install"
01643 
01644     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Uninstall..."] -underline 0 -command "plugins::uninstall"
01645     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Uninstall plugin"] "plugins::uninstall"
01646 
01647     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Reload"] -underline 0 -command "plugins::reload"
01648     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Reload all plugins"] "plugins::reload"
01649 
01650     if {[::tke_development]} {
01651 
01652       $mb add separator
01653       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Create..."] -underline 0 -command "plugins::create_new_plugin"
01654       launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Create new plugin"] "plugins::create_new_plugin"
01655 
01656     }
01657 
01658     # Allow the plugin architecture to add menu items
01659     plugins::handle_plugin_menu $mb
01660 
01661   }
01662 
01663   ######################################################################
01664   # Adds the help menu commands.
01665   proc add_help {mb} {
01666 
01667     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "User Guide"] -underline 0 -command [list utils::open_file_externally [file join $::tke_dir doc UserGuide.pdf]]
01668     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: View User Guide"] [list utils::open_file_externally [file join $::tke_dir doc UserGuide.pdf]]
01669 
01670     if {![string match *Win* $::tcl_platform(os)]} {
01671       if {[preferences::get General/UpdateReleaseType] eq "devel"} {
01672         set check_cmd "specl::check_for_update 0 [expr $specl::RTYPE_STABLE | $specl::RTYPE_DEVEL] {} menus::exit_cleanup"
01673       } else {
01674         set check_cmd "specl::check_for_update 0 $specl::RTYPE_STABLE {} menus::exit_cleanup"
01675       }
01676       $mb add separator
01677       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Check for Update"] -underline 0 -command $check_cmd
01678       launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Check for Update"] $check_cmd
01679     }
01680 
01681     $mb add separator
01682     
01683     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Send Feedback"] -underline 5 -command "menus::help_feedback_command"
01684     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Send Feedback"] "menus::help_feedback_command"
01685     
01686     $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "Send Bug Report"] -underline 5 -command "menus::help_submit_report"
01687     launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: Send Bug Report"] "menus::help_submit_report"
01688 
01689     if {[tk windowingsystem] ne "aqua"} {
01690       $mb add separator
01691       $mb add command -label [msgcat::mc "About TKE"] -underline 0 -command "gui::show_about"
01692       launcher::register [msgcat::mc "Menu: About TKE"] "gui::show_about"
01693     }
01694 
01695   }
01696   
01697   ######################################################################
01698   # Displays the User Guide.  First, attempts to show the epub version.
01699   # If that fails, display the pdf version.
01700   proc help_user_guide {} {
01701     
01702     if {[utils::open_file_externally "[file join $::tke_dir doc UserGuide.epub]"]} {
01703       utils::open_file_externally "[file join $::tke_dir doc UserGuide.pdf]"
01704     }
01705     
01706   }
01707 
01708   ######################################################################
01709   # Generates an e-mail compose window to provide feedback.
01710   proc help_feedback_command {} {
01711 
01712     utils::open_file_externally "mailto:phase1geo@gmail.com?subject=Feedback for TKE" 1
01713 
01714   }
01715   
01716   ######################################################################
01717   proc help_submit_report {} {
01718     
01719     # Retrieve the contents of the diagnostic logfile
01720     set log_content [logger::get_log]
01721     
01722     # Create the message body
01723     set body "Add bug description:\n\n\n\n\n$log_content"
01724     
01725     # Send an e-mail with the logfile contents
01726     utils::open_file_externally "mailto:phase1geo@gmail.com?subject=Bug Report for TKE&body=$body" 
01727     
01728   }
01729 
01730   ######################################################################
01731   # Displays the launcher with recently opened files.
01732   proc launcher {} {
01733 
01734     # Add favorites to launcher
01735     foreach fname [lrange [gui::get_last_opened] 0 [expr [preferences::get View/ShowRecentlyOpened] - 1]] {
01736       launcher::register_temp "`RECENT:$fname" [list gui::add_file end $fname] $fname
01737     }
01738 
01739     # Display the launcher in RECENT: mode
01740     launcher::launch "`RECENT:"
01741 
01742     # Unregister the recents
01743     foreach fname [lrange [gui::get_last_opened] 0 [expr [preferences::get View/ShowRecentlyOpened] - 1]] {
01744       launcher::unregister "`RECENT:$fname"
01745     }
01746 
01747   }
01748 
01749 }
